page.title: 05BURGHLEY: WASH DYKE POND
page.content: We started at the Kitchen Garden entrance to Burghley Park off Barnack Drift.We went west to Wash Dyke Pond.We had to go through a mixed woodland.On the south side it was deciduous and on the north side it was coniferous.On the north side under the conifers was bracken.The path that we went on was rough and slightly hilly.The woodland was dense but had a pleasent smell.It had a secluded atmosphere.We came out of the wood and looked over at some very large trees forming an avenue.We found them in a book to be Sweet Chestnuts.We went on and arrived at Wash Dyke Pond. Unfortunately there was no wildlife on the pond.We went from here to the Kitchen Gardens.
